original: Lindquist, Hugo Herman, direktör, Göteborg, f. 11/3/69 i Alingsås av fabr. Ax. L. o. Agnes Nyman. G. 93 m. Maggie Hill. Barn: Margot f. 94, d. 44, g. m. gen :maj. Hugo Gadd, Elsa 96, i sitt andra äkt. g. m. konstnär Wassia Kachenko, Gbg Lars 01, verk-st. dir, i Rosteri A-B Triangeln, Gbg, Hervor 03i Gbg. — Stud. v. Skara h. a. 1. o. hand:stud. i Gbg o. uti. Etabl. tills, m. Carl L. firma Bröd. Lindquist 90, ensam inneh. ’sed. 98, bild. Fören. Kaffeimportörers Rosteri A-B Triangeln i Gbg 03, verkst. dir. sed. dess bild. t. 47, ordf. i dess styr. Hed:-ordf. i Sv:es kafferosteriers fören., ordf. i Rosengrens Kassaskåpsfabr. A-B. Hobbies: opera, teater, musik. KV02kl, RNO, KTunNI.
translated: Lindquist, Hugo Herman, director, Gothenburg, b. 11/3/69 in Alingsås, son of factory owner Ax. L. and Agnes Nyman. Married in 1893 to Maggie Hill. Children: Margot b. 1894, d. 1944, married to general: Majore Hugo Gadd. Elsa b. 1896, in her second marriage married to artist Wassia Kachenko, Gothenburg. Lars b. 1901, manager director at Rosteri AB Triangeln, Gothenburg. Hervor b. 1903 in Gothenburg. Studied at Skara h. a. 1., and later studied in Gothenburg and abroad. Established together with Carl L. the company Bröd. Lindquist in 1890, sole owner since 1898. Co-founded the Association of Coffee Importers Rosteri AB Triangeln in Gothenburg in 1903, serving as its manager director since its establishment until 1947. Chairman of the board in the Association of Swedish Coffee Roasters. Chairman of Rosengrens Kassaskåpsfabrik AB. Hobbies: opera, theater, music. Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa, Commander of the Order of the North Star, Knight of the Order of the Polar Star.

structured.name: Hugo Herman Lindquist

affiliations.name: Association of Coffee Importers Rosteri AB Triangeln

structured.description: Hugo Herman Lindquist (1869-03-11), a Swedish director known for his work at Rosteri AB Triangeln in Gothenburg. He was born in Alingsås to Ax. L. Lindquist, a factory owner, and Agnes Nyman. In 1893, he married Maggie Hill. They had four children: Margot (1894-1944), Elsa (1896), Lars (1901), and Hervor (1903). Hugo studied at Skara h. a. 1. and later pursued education in Gothenburg and abroad. In 1890, he co-founded Bröd. Lindquist with Carl L., and became the sole owner in 1898. In 1903, he co-founded the Association of Coffee Importers Rosteri AB Triangeln, where he served as the manager director until 1947. Hugo also held various positions in different organizations, including the chairmanship of the Association of Swedish Coffee Roasters and Rosengrens Kassaskåpsfabrik AB. He had a great interest in opera, theater, and music. Hugo was honored with several awards, including Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa, Commander of the Order of the North Star, and Knight of the Order of the Polar Star.
